answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found two links you may find useful.
This is a copy of Texas State bill from 2011 which calls for the sale of delinquent tax receivables. 
ftp://ftp.legis.state.tx.us/bills/82R/fiscalnotes/html/house_bills/HB01900_HB01999/HB01903I.htm 
I also included the link to the International Factoring Association. They have more information on factoring organizations and a directory of their members in your community.
https://www.factoring.org/index.cfm?page=directory_action
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: [Anonymous]
text:
Hello, a Texas entity is looking for information from any individuals here that might have experience or research regarding the selling of receivables in the public sector. I've seen a little bit of research regarding how Florida and some Conn. municipalities handle delinquent property taxes, but I haven’t seen much beyond that.
I am particularly interested in learning if any Texas municipalities, counties, or state entities have engaged, or are currently engaged, in the practice of selling their accounts receivables - may they be delinquent or otherwise. Thank you for your assistance.
title: Selling of Receivables?
